content.question: Which of the following is the fourth-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f of x, equals, x times, sine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 4, end subscript, of x, equals, x minus, one sixth times x cubed, plus, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 5 factorial, end fraction, times x to the fifth power, minus, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 7 factorial, end fraction, times x to the seventh power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="P sub 4, end subscript, of x, equals, negative, x squared, plus, one sixth times x to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="P sub 4, end subscript, of x, equals, x squared, minus, one sixth times x to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="P sub 4, end subscript, of x, equals, 2 times x squared, plus 4 times x to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub 4, end subscript, of x, equals, x squared, minus, one sixth times x to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
